steps.title: Download and Install VS Code
steps.description:
- Visit the official VS Code website: https://code.visualstudio.com/
- Click on the "Download for Windows", "Download for macOS", or "Download for Linux" button based on your operating system.
- Run the downloaded installer and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation.

steps.title: Open VS Code
steps.description: Find the VS Code icon on your computer's desktop or start menu and launch it.

steps.title: Explore the User Interface
steps.description:
- **Title Bar:** Displays the name of the current file or folder you are working on.
- **Menu Bar:** Contains options for file management, editing, and more.
- **Activity Bar:** Provides access to various features like extensions, source control, and debugging.
- **Editor Area:** The main workspace where you write and edit your code.
- **Sidebar:** Displays the project explorer, file explorer, and search results.
- **Status Bar:** Shows information about the current file, such as line and column numbers, encoding, and language mode.

steps.title: Create a New Project
steps.description:
- Click on "File" > "New File" or press "Ctrl+N" (Windows/Linux) or "Cmd+N" (macOS) to create a new empty file.
- Save the file by clicking on "File" > "Save" or pressing "Ctrl+S" (Windows/Linux) or "Cmd+S" (macOS). Choose a suitable name and location for your project.

steps.title: Write Code
steps.description: Start typing your code directly in the editor area. VS Code provides syntax highlighting, auto-completion, and other features to assist you in writing code.

steps.title: Install Extensions
steps.description:
- Extensions enhance VS Code's capabilities. To install extensions, click on the "Extensions" icon in the Activity Bar.
- Search for the desired extensions in the search bar and click on the "Install" button.
- Restart VS Code for the extensions to take effect.

steps.title: Run and Debug Code
steps.description:
- **Run Code:** Depending on the programming language you are using, VS Code may have built-in support for running your code. Look for options like "Run" or "Debug" in the menu bar or the Activity Bar.
- **Debug Code:** Use the debugger to step through your code line by line, inspect variables, and identify any errors.

steps.title: Customize VS Code
steps.description:
- **Themes:** Change the appearance of VS Code by selecting different color themes.
- **Settings:** Configure VS Code's behavior and preferences, such as editor font, font size, and language settings.
- **Keyboard Shortcuts:** Customize keyboard shortcuts for common tasks.
